titleStmt.title: O. F. Rankin to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4408

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Thos E Bramlette
Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky
Sir,

Being personally acquainted with Mr Guthridge, and being anxious to reconcile him and his Brother with whom the Difficulty accurred and hoping that he will observe the pledge he makes you in his petition, and believing that the majesty of the law has been vindicated in the verdict, Judgment and payment of the fine, would respectfully request your interposition in his behalf and release him from the imprisonment, among the Petitioner will be formed Senator John F. Fisk, L. Shaw County Judge Joel Moffett Deputy Sheriff of this county and other prominent citizens.
